intro: Rhynchospora andresii, commonly known as the Andes sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, high-altitude environments such as mountain meadows and wetlands. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Rhynchospora andresii is characterized by its adaptation to cold climates and its ecological importance in its native habitat.
